ALLEGATION:
During school today at the facility, a staff member engaged in an argument with
youth in a classroom. Youth was making threats about beating people up and the
staff member told youth they were going to punch youth in the chest.

INVESTIGATION:
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 were interviewed face-to-face at the
facility, on 7/21/22. They reported Youth A is lodged under the West Campus
license and Staff 1 is employed under the East Campus license with the incident
taking place in the Lighthouse school which is located at the Kentwood license. The
teacher in the classroom is not an employee of the Wedgwood programs. Staff 1 has
been suspended and placed on leave while the investigation is ongoing. Both report
understanding Staff 1 did not punch Youth A but spoke as if she would. A
"restorative" meeting has taken place and Staff 1 apologized to Youth A.
Education Coordinator/Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on 7/21/22. She reported being "two rooms down" in another classroom when she
overheard an argument. She described the noise as loud voices arguing. She gave it
a minute before walking to the classroom the noise was coming from. When she
went into the classroom, she observed Staff 1 and Youth A arguing. Each were
telling the other to "shut up and stop talking to me". Staff 1 told Youth A to respect
her because she was the adult, and both began to use aggressive words with Youth
A saying he would beat other ups and Staff 1 responding with something like "when I
punch you in your chest". Neither stood up and as Youth A was removed from the
room, Staff 1 continued with challenging words towards him. She believes, Staff 1
was escalating the situation and never engaged in calm or therapeutic conversation
with Youth A. She also reported speaking to Staff 1 about the incident later in the
day and Staff 1 was surprised at what she is reported to have said. Education
Coordinator/Complainant believes, Staff 1 appears to have lost control of her
emotions during the moment.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/21/22. He reported
being present the day of the incident but does not remember "anything like" the
allegations.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/21/22. He reported
being present the day of the incident but "didn't see or hear anything".
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/21/22. He denied being
present in the classroom at the time of the incident.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/21/22. He reported
being present during the incident and hearing a lot of yelling. He believes it started
between Youth A and Youth F with Staff 1 observing the classroom at the time. Staff
1 questioned Youth A about being aggressive and began to argue with Youth A.
Staff 1 told Youth A to leave her classroom and not speak to her. Youth E never
heard treats of violence but believed Staff 1 was not listening and Youth A was not in
the wrong.

Youth F, Youth G, and Youth H were interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/21/22, separately. They all reported being present in the classroom at the time of
the incident but denied hearing any arguing.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/21/22. He reported the
incident began when he was speaking with a peer, and both were laughing when
Youth C told them to stop talking. Youth A told Youth C to say it out loud and not
under his breath. He also reported Staff 1 became engaged and stated, "don't worry
about it because I can fight" just before she told him she would punch him in the
chest. He responded with "bitch you ain't going to do shit". Staff 1 continued to talk
to him as he left the classroom.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/21/22. She reported being
in another classroom when the incident began and leaving her classroom to
investigate the yelling she heard. She wanted to see if someone needed help and
she heard Youth A yelling and Staff 1 saying "you think your tough". Staff 2
positioned herself between Youth A and Staff 1 and told Youth A to leave the room.
Staff 2 also reported as Youth A was leaving the room Staff 1 continued to say
things like "you think your tough" in a very disrespectful way. As Youth A was
leaving, he stood in the doorway threatening Staff 1 and Staff 1 stood up and started
to move towards him, so Staff 2 got Youth A outside and shut the door. Staff 1
opened the door twice with the second time to come out and use the restroom.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/21/22. She reported being
in the classroom during the incident and Staff 1 responded to Youth A saying
something. Staff 1 responded with "who do you think your talking to”, and more
words exchanged but neither moved from their seats. Staff 3 was unclear about the
specific words Staff 1 used but it was said loudly and something like punching Youth
A. Staff 1 did nothing to deescalate Youth A. She also reported Staff 1 tends to
"always pick up the rope" which means she does not let things go when she arguers
with a youth. Staff 1 always tries to let youth know she is not scared of them and
wants them to know she could do something but will not.
Teacher was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/21/22. She reported not
hearing what Youth A said to Staff 1 but she reported hearing Staff 1 respond by
telling Youth A it was disrespectful and began to yell at Youth A. They were yelling
back and forth when Youth A swore at Staff 1 and Staff 1 responded by telling him
she was going to punch him in the stomach or gut. Teacher also reported at this
point, Youth E started to argue with Staff 1, and she argued back. Teacher was
unable to recall what was specifically said. Teacher gave her description of Staff 1
since she has had numerous interactions with her. Staff 1 wants to be one of the
kids and be at their level. Arguing with youth is not uncommon for her.
Staff 1 was interviewed via video telephone on 7/22/22. She reported Youth A
and another youth were talking and they began to argue and threaten to fight each
other. She told Youth A "not to come into the classroom and drain the energy".

Youth A responded with "bitch don't talk to me because I will go off the rails". Staff 1
reported meeting Youth A at the same level and told him to calm down because no
one is scared of him. Youth A then told her he could beat up everyone. She
responded by telling him she was going to "knock some sense into him". Youth A
was removed from the room while Staff 1 was still talking to him. She also reported
speaking to the "School Supervisor" and stating that she was alright but could have
handled the situation differently. She denied saying she would punch Youth A but
said she would knock sense into him as a figure of speech. She agreed she said
things she should not have said. She believed Youth A was being disruptive in the
classroom and wanted him to try a different classroom. She also believed she was
getting the message that he "needs to respect and not threaten others".
Documents Reviewed:
Suitable Treatment and Freedom of Movement Procedures dated 4/13/18. This
document outlines the treatment of youth in the program. It begins with the
statement "treatment with dignity and respect" and also states, "treatment without
emotional harm to youth". Staff are to address youth in a respectful manner and
avoid any display of hostility such as speaking in an angry manner.
Significant Event Report dated 7/19/22. This report outlines the situation
described in the allegations. Staff present are identified as Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Education Coordinator/Complainant. Youth A is identified as also being present. The
event details are outlined as reported by those interviewed.
Human Resources information on Staff 1. Staff 1 is current on required training
with 75.25 hours over the past five months. Documentation in the file indicates Staff
1 received a "verbal warning on 5/2/22 for being late to work on three days
beginning with Tuesday 4/26, Wednesday 4/27, and Friday 4/28. The expectation is
Staff 1 will incur no future tardy days to work. The other disciplinary action in the file
is Staff 1's termination from employment due to her actions occurring in the
allegations in this investigation.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow
written policies and procedures that prohibit the following
forms of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth’s background or appearance or mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.

ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 engaged in
derogatory language, yelling and threatening Youth A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend no change to the license status of this child caring institution.
